summary.p: 10 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 25; Qurʾānic Text: Q 3:172-3:200; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 280 x 200mm; Script style: kūfī D.Va.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
10 fol. 200×280 mm (1.4). Support: thin transparent parchment of yellowish color. Writing material: dark brown ink.
Collation: one quire, H1F H2F S H3F S H4F S H5F / F6H F7H S F8H S F9H S F10H. Fol. 1 and 10, once a bifolium, are now separated from each other, fol. 5–6 is a bifolium.
Text layout: 103×193 mm (1.875), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D Va. Diacritics: occasionally diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: red and green round dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – tear-shaped golden medallions (type 4.1.1) with the inscribed word آية, in the text and above the line; for groups of five verses – round medallions on the margins (types 2''.A.II and 4.A.II) in gold and colours with the word خمس inscribed, and accompanied with the golden letter ﻪ (hā) above the line at the actual border of the verses; for groups of ten verses – large medallions on the margins in gold and red color (type 3.B.II) with the numbers of verses inscribed (ماية و ثمنون – fol. 4r, ماية و تسعون – fol. 7v).
Inscriptions: numbers of surahs and verses are inscribed on all sheets in pencil.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold.

Defects: traces of moisture and extensive stains, especially on the first and last sheets; fragments of margins missing (probably damaged by rodents or fire); parchment crumbling along the folds; minor parchment destruction caused by aggressive ink; ink from the flesh sides has imprinted on the opposite hair sides, especially on fol. 3r and 4r.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with letters “CL”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink – “10 f. 7 lignes / IIIe S. v 167 à 200” and old accession number in red pencil “B. 3”.
Old accession numbers: CL (on the wrapping), B. 3 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–10v. Surah 3, verses 166(172) – 200(200). Incipit:[القرح] للذين أحسنوا . Explicit: اصبِروا [وصابروا] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
